implementation.signature: def __init__(self, recipient_email_list: Optional[Union[list, tuple, str]] = None, context_data: Optional[dict] = None, attachment_list: Optional[list] = None, **kwargs) -> None:
implementation.comment:
Initialisation takes a single or list of email addresses and some context data. This context data
might be provided from the factory to avoid querying data more than necessary.
implementation.gen_code:
def __init__(self, recipient_email_list: Optional[Union[list, tuple, str]] = None, context_data: Optional[Dict] = None, attachment_list: Optional[List] = None, **kwargs) -> None:
    self.SUBJECT_PREFIX = None
    self.FROM_EMAIL = None
    self.REPLY_TO_ADDRESS = []
    self._errors = []
    self.subject = None
    self.template_name = None
    self.template_txt_name = None
    if isinstance(recipient_email_list, (list, tuple, str)):
        self.recipient_email_list = recipient_email_list if isinstance(recipient_email_list, (list, tuple)) else [recipient_email_list]
    else:
        self.recipient_email_list = []
    self.cc_email_list = []
    self.bcc_email_list = []
    self.attachment_list = attachment_list if attachment_list is not None else []
    self.context_data = context_data if context_data is not None else {}
    for key, value in kwargs.items():
        setattr(self, key, value)

implementation.gen_code:
def get_context_data(self) -> dict:
    data = self.context_data.copy()
    data.update({'subject': self.get_subject(), 'from_email': self.get_from_email(), 'reply_to': self.get_reply_to_emails(), 'cc': self.get_cc_emails(), 'bcc': self.get_bcc_emails(), 'attachments': self.get_attachments()})
    return data

implementation.comment:
This method provides the subject of the email. Prefixes every subject to create a similar look and feel across
emails. Can be overridden if required.
Use set `FROM_EMAIL` or the django base `DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL` if it is not set

Method to be overwritten. Returns a list of file-paths which will be attached to the newly created email.

implementation.comment: Method to encapsulate logic of adding attachments to an email object.

This method creates a mail object. It collects the required variables, sets the subject and makes sure that
a "reply_to" is set for maximum convenience during the runtime.
The plaintext part of the email is generated from the html to avoid maintaining duplicate templates.
implementation.comment_free_code:
def _build_mail_object(self) -> EmailMultiAlternatives:
    
    language = self.get_translation()
    if language:
        translation.activate(language)
    mail_attributes = self.get_context_data()
    html_content = render_to_string(self.template_name, mail_attributes)
    if not self.template_txt_name:
        h = html2text.HTML2Text()
        h.body_width = 0
        text_content = h.handle(html_content)
    else:
        text_content = render_to_string(self.template_txt_name, mail_attributes)
    msg = EmailMultiAlternatives(self.get_subject(), text_content, from_email=self.get_from_email(), cc=self.get_cc_emails(), bcc=self.get_bcc_emails(), reply_to=self.get_reply_to_emails(), to=self.recipient_email_list)
    msg.attach_alternative(html_content, 'text/html')
    msg = self._add_attachments(msg)
    return msg
implementation.gen_code:
def _build_mail_object(self) -> EmailMultiAlternatives:
    subject = self.get_translation() or self.subject
    from_email = self.FROM_EMAIL or 'no-reply@example.com'
    if self.template_name:
        html_content = render_to_string(self.template_name, self.get_context_data())
        text_content = strip_tags(html_content)
    else:
        html_content = text_content = 'This is an auto-generated email.'
    msg = EmailMultiAlternatives(subject, text_content, from_email, self.recipient_email_list, cc=self.cc_email_list, bcc=self.bcc_email_list, reply_to=self.REPLY_TO_ADDRESS)
    msg.attach_alternative(html_content, 'text/html')
    self._add_attachments(msg)
    return msg
